page.title: 02WINFORD HOSPITAL
page.content: The hospital was built in the early 1930's at Winford for {crippled {children with rheumatic heart disease. {Winford Orthopaedic Hospital}now has 226 beds. It is one of the{largest}in the country. Patients are admitted from{Avon, South Gloucestershire, {North Somerset and Gwent. }There is no out patient department, but the { {Physiotherapy and X-Ray departments} provide an out patient sevice for referrals from local GP's. {PHYSIOTHERAPY DEPARTMENT.} This was opened in 1964 and includes a large treatment room, several smaller treatment rooms, and a{hydrotherapy {pool.}There are two sessions each week for{Riding for the Disabled. {X-RAY DEPARTMENT.
